intro: Pilosella micradenophora, commonly known as the slender pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves, with small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Pilosella micradenophora is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
